website_summaries.verdict: An innovative hand gripper that enables you to isolate and exercise each finger individually.
pros: Challenges each finger individually so stronger ones can't compensate for weaker ones
Ergonomic base sits in the palm of your hand
cons: The design of this product may be too small for large hands

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my Clients Alive
customer_reviews.text: I use this often as I sit on the phone with clients to curb my stress and keep me from physically reaching through the phone to strangle them.
customer_reviews.author: BadTactic

customer_reviews.title: Separate springs for each finger tip is great for developing finger strength
customer_reviews.text: I use this exerciser to build up finger strength for guitar playing. Separate springs for each finger make this much better than other hand exercisers for developing strength in your smaller fingers. Squeeze with the tips of your fingers for best results. I alternate between the red medium tension and blue light tension models, with dozens of reps on each one. Quality seems very good.
customer_reviews.author: l2Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: FAKE PRODUCT. NOT ACTUALLY A GRIP MASTER
customer_reviews.text: I bought a red (med tension) for drums and golf and loved it so I recently ordered the blue ( light tension) and the black (heavy tension). This is not a grip master. It also has less tension then my blue grip master. When you order something and get something else it should be zero stars RED FLAGS etc. To prevent others from wasting their time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Handy after surgery
customer_reviews.text: Used while rehabbing after shoulder surgery. Kept hand and forearm active while the rest of my arm was immobile. Ideal while watching TV, too! Started with. Then this blue "light tension" Gripmaster at 5 pounds per finger. Then. For a bit of opposing exercise I liked. Seemed sort of hokey at first but the muscle burn came on fast. That's NOT hokey.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence WalshTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good work out for improved finger strength and dexterity
customer_reviews.text: I went with max tension black, as a guitar player (and general ADD fidget spinner type of guy). It works. Similar to a heavy playing workout, but more addressing brute individual finger strength. Even with playing guitar and bass all the time, it provides a challenging little work out, is comfortable in the hand, light/fits easily in a pocket, and fills moments of tension or boredom with something more constructive than messing around with my phone. It will definitely put your right (or left) primary hand in stark contrast to your secondary hand...I'm a righty and my left was put in it's place quickly as total girly man grip in comparison to start. It is catching up though.
customer_reviews.author: Well_Poet

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality and Value for Rehab
customer_reviews.text: This is what the professional therapists use and is an inexpensive way to rehabilitate your hand/wrist.My physical therapist gave me the blue (light) tension in the middle of rehabbing my broken wrist. As that became easy I ordered the black (heavy) tension from Amazon. It is helping me to continue to push myself and improve. Chances are that a patient will need at least a couple of different tension strengths if you are rehabbing. They are certainly good quality and stand up to a lot of use.
customer_reviews.author: ALS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my young students
customer_reviews.text: I teach guitar and ukulele to young students, and these are perfect for them to try to start building strength in their fingers as they start to play. I keep different strengths of these around and let my students borrow them for a few weeks at a time until they're ready for the next one up. It's helped them gain a lot of finger strength quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: For a child who plays the cello
customer_reviews.text: this is the perfect tool to gain strength in the fingers for fretting the strings properly. He's struggled with the motion due to weakness, and playing alone will not increase that skill. So he fidgets with this for 10 minutes a few times a day for a few weeks, and his playing has greatly improved! It's perfect for popping in your left hand while you do another skill or just watching tv! This model is the perfect resistance for an 8 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Teffer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy and very effective grip strengthener
customer_reviews.text: This line of grip strengtheners is one of the best of its type, I have two of them. Smooth, even operation, doesn't pinch like cheap ones. Single-digit articulation and isolation is very good, so whether you need that for a musical instrument or trigger control - this is probably the speed you want. If you're working on dumbbell grip, the strengths above this might be a better choice (although it looks like you can get a pack with all the resistance levels). What could be improved: Offer a single adjustable strengthener, to take up less space, less to keep track of.
customer_reviews.author: D.M.

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed. Finger buttons are solid and springs have consistent pressure. Doesn't squeak. Better price than the store. I got the black heavy tension model for use while I'm nursing a bad shoulder but still want some forward movement on my strength. I have a fairly decent grip (lots of pullups and farmer carries) but my forearm is getting fatigued after a minute. Good workout tool. On the fingertips, its a heavy pull but in the fist, its easier. One drawback: My hands aren't huge (M to L gloves) and this is just the right size. If you have XL hands, this could be too small. I gave it 5 stars but and XL guy may only give it 3-4.
customer_reviews.author: Martinson

customer_reviews.title: Instant love!
customer_reviews.text: I have an old school, one wire whole hand style strengthener on my desk. When this came, on the first test, right out of the package, i could'nt put it down. The package came with a few hand and finger exercises and a website where you can find more. The bi-spring design for each finger position works very well to keep the pressure in a constant direction for maximum benefit of each squeeze. I like that you can use your finger tips, finger pads or wrap your fingers around it in a grip style squeeze for whole hand strength. Having individual finger placements shows me which fingers need a little more strength training than others. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Will do that for which it is designed.
customer_reviews.text: Again. This product is what I ordered and needed. It arrived early on the day it was to arrive, not late as it was indicated it might. It is not an easy therapy but it does allow selecting individual fingers, combinations of fingers, or the exercising of all fingers at the same time. Again, "No Pain No Gain." The device will do what it is supposed to do if one "USES" it correctly and regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Houston

customer_reviews.title: A stressball might be better
customer_reviews.text: The product works pretty well as intended. It provides proper pushback for you to exercise your fingers. However, the two weakest fingers really don't get much of a workout due to the straight nature of the grip. You have to contort to try to get those fingers to exercise equally to the rest of the hand. That is more of an issue with this type of product rather than with this product in particular. My foam stressball does a better job of letting me exercise my fingers equally.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not very challenging but it seems good for exactly what i got it for - to ...
customer_reviews.text: Not very challenging but it seems good for exactly what i got it for - to be able to move my fingers on the violin strings. Light weight, many repetitions seems to be the better route when speedy fingers is the goal, similar to working out, not trying to bulk up my fingers. I can easily pump out 30 reps of this and not feel like i worked out my fingers but I know its working because when I started i felt a workout after about 20.
customer_reviews.author: Custom

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: No complaints about this thing. It does exactly what it's supposed to do. Sturdy. Each finger plunger stays firmly on track and doesn't wobble around. I don't anticipate any problem with it breaking. I believe the multi-finger grip exercise is better than a full-hand grip things. You can tell the difference because of how much more difficult some of the fingers are to fully depress. On a full-hand grip the other fingers would compensate and hide this weakness.
customer_reviews.author: RaveTheTadpole

customer_reviews.title: Training for my Hubby, maybe some stress relief too
customer_reviews.text: My hubby used to give the shortest, weak back rubs. When he said his hands would hurt and that's why they were so short, I bought him this! Not sure if he's using it every day since I also called it a "stress relief hand thingy" for his work stress but it appears to be working well. My massages have gotten longer and more effecient! And don't worry, I used to be a masseuse so his massages are bomb.
customer_reviews.author: Sassafras&Molasses

customer_reviews.title: Stress relief
customer_reviews.text: When I used to do more weight training I would carry 45 lb plates with my finger tips to increase my gripping strength. Now I sit around in the office most of the time and I obviously can't go around carrying plates in the office. I found this to be a good forearm exercising tool when you are just sitting around. The individual fingers are good too because you can also train your pinky as well, which is actually quite hard. Overall, I would recommend this product. It was made well, feels good to the touch and forms well with your hand. Good stress relief and a pass time work out for your forearms.
customer_reviews.author: MmmmBBQ

customer_reviews.title: My secret weapon
customer_reviews.text: Have been using a grip master for years. My friend, a trumpet player, turned me on to them. It's the secret to my many years, that put me firmly in the "elder" category, and complete dexterity in both my hands. I have several around the house, take it with me when I walk or work out, and have a few at my other home in another country. Can't be without this little marvel....AND it feels good to use it. Great product, reasonably priced, quickly shipped. Excellent seller.
customer_reviews.author: NNE

customer_reviews.title: Helps me achieve my goals in grip strength
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help with my climbing strength and I already had the medium level so I knew what I was getting into. It was a great next step for me and helped me increase my pinch and crimping strength pretty quickly. At first it was just challenging enough but now its getting easier where after 10-15 min I can feel it in more forearms. Worth it, would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jason Klug

customer_reviews.title: Professional grade - used at Occupational Therapy
customer_reviews.text: My friend had to go to Occupational Therapy due to work injury and they had these there. I purchased this for him so he could continue to rehabilitate his hand at home after the sessions were over and now he has full strength and range of motion.
customer_reviews.author: Styna

customer_reviews.title: Get BUFF fingers
customer_reviews.text: Well I play the ukelele and would have trouble barring chords (pressing down on multiple strings) so I decided to try this grip master. I like that the trainer has individual finger weights so I can train my dedicated barring fingers or whole hand whenever I want. Legit you’ll definitely feel the burn especially if you haven’t trained your hand and fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Marvel Man

customer_reviews.title: S necessity for hand/wrist recovery. Or to develop a knuckle ball
customer_reviews.text: This has really helped me. My wrist was essentially rebuilt in July of 2017.About four months in to PT/IT this was suggested to me. It really helped. When I developed a TFCC tear, which usually comes with the original injury but is almost impossible to diagnose until the ORC surgery adds stress this helped the backsliding in my grip strength back. I use this about ten minutes twice a day, but I think I'm where I'll be. But atrophy is a danger. Oh yeah, if you're a pitcher you can use this to add a knuckle ball to your armory.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon M. Pyron

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for guitar players
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help me with finger strength for guitar playing. I must have very weak fingers because this device even on light tension was tough on my ring and pinky fingers. I've been using it for about 10 minutes every day and am definitely seeing improvement in my strength. If you have a difficult time pressing strings with your ring finger then I would recommend starting with this light tension to build up finger strength. I gave this 4 stars because I wish it was adjustable so that I could increase the tension now that my finger strength has increased.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: For a Male for Guitar training, get the RED one.
customer_reviews.text: For guitar training - Get the RED one. I'm a male, fairly good grip strength and playing guitar. I wanted something to keep up with finger strength and dexterity when traveling where I can't bring a guitar. The red one is perfect. It is strong enough to give a good workout, yet light enough for me to compress the springs with each finger individually. If a female (guitarist, not athlete or rock-climber) is looking for something for guitar, they may be better served initially by using the next lighter Gripmaster, at least initially.
customer_reviews.author: Pragmatist

customer_reviews.title: I love the design but the plastic tips are a little ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the design but the plastic tips are a little hard on the fingers... would be 5 stars if they were rubber tips. So I added rubber tips ... small furniture floor grippers. They feel great ....
customer_reviews.author: Nimu13

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to enough tension for a person with ...
customer_reviews.text: Not even close to enough tension for a person with normal ability. Perhaps it is designed to rehabilitate people that need to build strength after an injury/surgery, but it isn't advertised that way.
customer_reviews.author: Willis

customer_reviews.title: New models are low quality not as much tension
customer_reviews.text: I am buying this item to replace one that I purchased years ago but gave away to a friend. I was disappointed to see that this item is now made very cheaply....my previous version was sturdier and better made. find a better quality item. The tension on this gripper is significantly less than previous model.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Does what it suppose to
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom to regain strength in her hand. The ball that the doctor recommended wasn’t working. My mom uses this everyday. Worth looking into if you need something like this.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: pricey but very effective and durable
customer_reviews.text: everything is so good about this product, My 12 years old has red and blue, 8 year old uses yellow and 4 years old uses green for their piano finer use I cannot leave it five star cause I think it is over priced, I love the product though
customer_reviews.author: Good Realtor

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I am a 19 year old female of average height and weight and the red (medium tension) is pretty good for me. The size is perfect maybe edging a little small. I can squeeze it a while and my hand gets tired before long so I feel like it will make improvements to my grip if I keep using it. I work in maintenance so I’m always loosening and tightening and carrying crap so I’m hoping this’ll help me be better at my job. Four stars because it feels kinda cheap and plastic-y but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked For Me After a Drunken Handstand Accident
customer_reviews.text: A year ago I was drunk in a basement club and I attempted a dance move that included a handstand. A few months later the uncomfortable feeling in my wrist from this foolish move remained. After using this gripmaster for 2 weeks the pain is gone, for the most part. It definitely improved it to the point that i can do push ups again. I know, I'm an idiot. But still, i say all this to say this thing worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: DunDee910

customer_reviews.title: Finger exerciser.
customer_reviews.text: Have large hand and fiND a challenge in speed exercises however still can see and appreciate this product. Thanks Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I like it. It's kind of addicting to work each ...
customer_reviews.text: For what it's supposed to do, I like it. It's kind of addicting to work each finger, especially the ring fingers. Quality-wise, it feels cheap and if not used correctly, could break apart more easily. The plastic grip feels like it could pop out from it's placement and I'm thinking of applying superglue to permanently keep it sticking together. If you've never done finger strengthening exercises before (NOT PALM/GRIP STRENGTHENING!), this is a good start, maybe even extra-light tension. I thought Light tension would be too easy. That was true for my index and middle finger, but not so much for my ring and pinky finger, which I was hoping to strengthen.
customer_reviews.author: fdesa12

customer_reviews.title: Has some issues, might look at others
customer_reviews.text: Needs a better retention of the rubber palm pad. IT also needs a more adequate internal lubricant.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Husband Loves!
customer_reviews.text: Husband has the medium and loves it but wanted something more satisfying since that became easy. Tracked down the same brand here and found it for a decent price. These hold up extremely well, as he has had his first one for years. Definitely fun to use while bored at work also.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great physical therapy tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to strengthen my fingers and wrist after 2 surgeries due to a broken radius and ulna and ligament tears. It’s small and easy to carry in my bag for use on the go. An easy and cheap physical therapy exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Karbear

customer_reviews.title: Helped me keep muscle in my hands and forearms while recovering from a back and neck injury
customer_reviews.text: I hurt my back and neck and I started to lose strength in my hands and forearm. I needed something to keep the muscles I could exercise at the time strong, so I bought one of these to help. Its nice to keep in your pocket or bag and use while working. I also started to have problems in my hand from using a mouse, and after a week of using this Gripmaster, the cramping in my hand went away.
customer_reviews.author: Minority Report

customer_reviews.title: Well done
customer_reviews.text: Seems to offer lots of possibilities for such a small piece of equipment. Also appears to be very well built, which is important considering all the moving parts. Only thing I would reinforce is to make sure you go with a light enough tension to start with because they are harder than you think, especially on the pinky finger.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for LARGE hands.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent idea, but not quite what you want if you have large hands. This would be good for people with medium hands and excellent for those with small hands. WATCH OUT if you are a guy. The tendency is to go all macho and go with the heaviest resistance. I got the blue (light resistance) and after just a few minutes find the muscles in my hand are worn out. Will it get better? I'll bet on it, but why buy one that requires weeks of training to fully utilize? I think a medium or light to be best.
customer_reviews.author: Pat-inCO

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: This product by far exceeded my standards! Works extremely well and I use it at work when I am bored! One of my friends seen me using this and took it for herself because she needed one. So I let her have it as an early Christmas present being that she works for the post office and she could definitely use it for hand and forearm strengthening. I even went out and ordered another for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Juggernaut

customer_reviews.title: They need to make an asymetrical version
customer_reviews.text: So... Whose idea was it that every finger has the exact same strength??? I ordered the heavy, and the first two offer no resistance whatsoever. The ring finger offered slight resistance (barely enough to consider training), and the pinky is too heavy to move beyond a few mil. I mean, it's a clever ploy to get you to order all the different colors... I'll give them that. And I will admit to being a dumb consumer willfully stepping into their conspicuous trap. Going to try out all the weights.
customer_reviews.author: Michael the Psycho

customer_reviews.title: Very good finger strengthener for playing musical instruments etc.
customer_reviews.text: great exerciser. Bought this to strengthen my fingers for the main purpose of playing musical instruments. Bought the Extra Light tension. felt improvement so will be moving on to the light tension next and just keep moving up! Very good quality. good grip. great size. etc. Helps you to work out individual fingers or multiple fingers in any combination you'd like to. Very please with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Jaundoo

customer_reviews.title: Well made and versitile
customer_reviews.text: This is my third one, adding to the extra light and medium. Very versatile hand exerciser that allows you to emulate many different fingering activities. Found helpful for keeping my arthritic hands in guitar playing shape. Have had the medium for years, very durable. Aforementioned arthritis has required me to add the lighter ones to my collection for some exercises.
customer_reviews.author: J. Newton

customer_reviews.title: Great for climbers!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my boyfriend’s birthday. We’re both rock climbers and I bought this when we were fairly new to the sport to help work on his finger strength. It’s definitely helped with our climbing abilities in terms of using specific holds that require more finger strength. Would definitely recommend for climbers!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Bought Because I Had Frequent Hand Cramps; Worked Great
customer_reviews.text: I thought about buying one of these years ago to strengthen my hands for guitar playing. I admittedly do not play any where close to the amount I'd like to. My hands and fingers would cramp up within 10-15 minutes of playing. My hands would also cramp up from doing things like the dishes or giving back massages. This product has helped immensely. I can get the dishes completely done without coming close to my hands cramping. I haven't touched my guitar in months but this product's usefulness has reflected in many facets of my life. It's great to just grab and do while watching TV. I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Adam K

customer_reviews.title: This is the best of the three I tried
customer_reviews.text: This is the best of the three I tried. The first one was - "Epitomie Fitness Finger Master" - great idea but jerky movements. The second - "Gripmaster Pro Edition" - a bit better but feels kind of flimsy. This one - the "Gripmaster Hand Exerciser Heavy Tension" feels very solid and gets 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Adams

customer_reviews.title: Three stars
customer_reviews.text: Decent exerciser. Rubber pad will come off in first week. If you are grip enthusiast be ready that this thing will worn up pretty fast. Got blue one. I guess it is for kids ot teenagers. Because amount of tension is really small. If you want to work out get the heaviest one. In general it is not bad. If you have big hands this might be too small for you.
customer_reviews.author: Artem Korsakov

customer_reviews.title: Slightly small but gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for a way to increase my grip strength and I’m glad I found these. I started with the black as my first and it was difficult st first . You do get used to it pretty quickly but it provides thre right amount of resistance. I plan on buying higher tension ones in the future. My only complain is that it is a little small and would’ve preferred a bigger Soe (I heard the pro is bigger)
customer_reviews.author: J.oli

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously small! Avoid!
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously small! I have small, slim hands (I am female) and when this thing arrived in the mail I couldn't believe how small it was. My hand dwarfs it and it is too small to be usable. Please don't buy this unless you have child-sized hands!
customer_reviews.author: MochiCake

customer_reviews.title: Works to improve finger strength.
customer_reviews.text: When I received it, I immediately used it. My left hand's little finger had no strength, which was why I purchased it. Within a couple days, my little finger functioned again, and then I purchased a more resistant model. This and the stiffer product, also improved my right hand, which suffers from carpel tunnel syndrome.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Sly

customer_reviews.title: Great item for home use to boost strength in lower arms and hands
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily and it does help both my grip and lower arm musculature. I think this would be helpful for about anyone losing arm strength with age as well as enjoying extreme sports. For us both were true. This is something you can use every day while watching the news and you can see dramatic improvement immediately as well as measureable strength increases within a week or so. It would have to be good for folks just encountering arthritis as well. As long as the hands work this would help stave off problems. It is however fairly strong so if one was already crippled up it would be impossible to use.
customer_reviews.author: 60Spears

customer_reviews.title: Good Hand Exerciser
customer_reviews.text: had broken my arm just above the wrist and physical therapist had a Red, Medium Tension (7-Pounds per Finger) gripmaster which was extremely to hard to squeeze. I purchased the Yellow, X-Light Tension (3-Pounds per Finger) and quickly "master this one", probably should of purchased the Blue Light Tension (5-Pounds per Finger) to compliment my PT. Excellent quality. really easy to squeeze
customer_reviews.author: Susan C

customer_reviews.title: Separate springs for each finger makes so much sense.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this unit. It is comfortable to use and with each finger having their own spring, works the weaker fingers more to bring them up to snuff. Otherwise the already stronger fingers do too much of the work.
customer_reviews.author: wolfhound

customer_reviews.title: ProHands GripMaster Hand/Finger Exerciser
customer_reviews.text: Nicely designed and contoured hand/finger exerciser. Great for rehabilitating individual fingers, etc. Well constructed with good tension. Sturdy springs. Works as hoped. Happy with the purchase. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Train

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool For Hand Exercise!
customer_reviews.text: Great hand exerciser! I'm using this to train my fingers/grip for rock wall climbing. It helps a TON with my gripping! (Funny thing is I bought the black one cause black is my favorite color, not knowing that these are color coded for their difficulty level, so I accidentally started myself out with the heavy tension, haha!)
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: 7lbs is far too light
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help train my forearms for climbing. I've been using the ol' squeezy handle sort of grip strengthener and decided that a finger-strength grip exerciser might help me for those crimpy climbs. 7Lbs is far too light, however, so despite the product being great, it's far too weak to help anyone who has been climbing for more than a week.
customer_reviews.author: Jake and Amy

customer_reviews.title: Way Too Small For An Adult, Inaccurate Description, No refunds!
customer_reviews.text: This product was way too small for an adult to comfortably use. Inaccurate website description, which lead to getting a product with way too little tension. Also, no refund granted. Stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: This product seems very sturdy. I also use the Varigrip and like it ...
customer_reviews.text: This product seems very sturdy. I also use the Varigrip and like it a lot. I play guitar and I can really tell the difference in my playing with these hand exercisers. I'm not a huge fan of how the gripmaster sort of tilts back and forth--I wish I would hold straight, but whatever. I also am an idiot and didn't realize the blue one was light tension--my fault... I just wanted the blue one because of the color but would have preferred the medium tension. For a person with average strength, the light tension is too wimpy. But that's my fault. Party on gripmaster.
customer_reviews.author: tark wayne

customer_reviews.title: Good tool to strengthen your "finger" press
customer_reviews.text: It's too weak to get much exercise out of using the whole hand, but good way to strengthen your "finger press". Using it for a while to increase the grip strength
customer_reviews.author: Sam P.

customer_reviews.title: Like PT at home
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for grip strengthening. Just like the ones I’ve used during physical therapy / rehab on my hand and wrist. Easy to use. Work on your strengthening your arm from comfort of your couch.
customer_reviews.author: YachtGirl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for finger joint pain
customer_reviews.text: I used to own this item years ago and used to use it often when i was typing both at work, school and home. After i lost that one. I started to developed finger joint pain. I remembered when i used this i didn't have that pain. Purchased and have been using again and my fingers joint pain is much better!
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for strengthening hands and fingers
customer_reviews.text: I use this blue Gripmaster for my weaker fingers and the red unit for the stronger ones. Both Gripmasters work like a charm. Highly recommended if you'd like more dextrous fingers.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Good way to 'exercise' at office
customer_reviews.text: I use it in office, where I have a regular desk job - meaning no physical movement. Whenever I get some free time, I use it and while it does not provide a full on exercise like a gym would, it at least gives you something to not feel guilty about being lazy all day. I ordered a medium stress model and soon will be upgrading to heavier ones.
customer_reviews.author: amol

customer_reviews.title: Has pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how weak my small fingers on both hands were, and this hand exerciser will be extremely helpful in the overall and balanced strength development. I gave this product 4 stars (not 5) only because it is very insufficient for the other fingers: it is too weak, even though the product description says "heavy tension". I know that my grip strength is moderate at best, and the word "heavy" does not apply if the springs are too easy for me to exercise with for several dozen times in a set. If you are not sure, I would recommend that you buy one piece, try it, and then buy another one if it meets your expectations.
customer_reviews.author: D. G.

customer_reviews.title: Good for rehabilitation of tendons
customer_reviews.text: I find the Blue 5 pound to be very challenging on my injured left hand. I can use the overhand grip on all fingers, but for the injured fingers I can't do some of the top presses yet. I use the Via Prohands by Gripmaster at the 2 pounds of pressure for individual finger work and the regular Gripmaster in Blue for the big grip exercises. My high school students in sports love playing with it and the majority of them find the blue to be a bit too easy. I read somewhere that the blue is meant for the average woman's hands and the red is the average man's. Based on our experiences, that seems about right.
customer_reviews.author: VeggieSD

customer_reviews.title: too difficult for me
customer_reviews.text: Its hard to assign an appropriate number of stars to this because it is not the fault of the product that it is too difficult for my hands. I had no idea what level to start with and guessed Light tension would be good but wish I had started with extra-light because apparently I have really weak hands. I got these to help strengthen my hands for doing repetitive surgeries and I think conceptually its a great idea, just hard to know which one to start with. So if you are like me and have arthritis in your hands or just starting out in hand exercise, I recommend this product, but recommend starting with the extra-light tension.
customer_reviews.author: Elsie

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend the Musician, who this was purchased for, never uses it. To recoup some of my hurt feelings, I began using it myself. And low and behold, I noticed some of my hand tension and joint pains going away. How unexpected! So, this handy-dandy tool is not only a wonderful gift for ungrateful boyfriends, but also a wonderful exerciser for carpal-tunnel prone cat ladies.
customer_reviews.author: Arya

customer_reviews.title: Additional option would be great
customer_reviews.text: The Gripmaster Hand Exerciser is great for hand strengthening, but may not be exactly appropriate for my current injury. I have a radial nerve palsy that is preventing me from using my wrist or hand. Seine using the Gripmaster, my hand strength has increased, but I do wish both sides weren't able to be squeezed. An additional option that just let you work the fingers would be great for this, as I can't move my fingers individually. Nevertheless, this is an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Grant

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Therapy
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a therapy tool for my left hand. I have polyarthritis in two of my fingers, and using this for a couple minutes every day helps maintain some hand strength and dexterity. I won't lie, it hurts like hell after a while but it keeps my hand from being useless. This particular device appeals to me because of the individual springs, and the firm cushion on the bottom that helps keep it stable in my hand. The motion is smooth and the fit is very comfortable. It jumbles around in my purse a lot, but still hangs in there, so its durable. I'd definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Dove

customer_reviews.title: No noticeable improvement over standard grippers
customer_reviews.text: The only real difference between this and the standard grippers they sell for 5 dollars nearly everywhere, is that you can use individual fingers. It's difficult to describe how the machine falls short of this goal, but it does. I found greater benefit just from using standard grippers, both in terms of overall grip strength and each individual finger. I'd also like to add that the device is small and the tension is lighter that I expected. I don't have large hands by any measure, and the medium tension device is very small in my hands. The overall tension was unchallenging as well.
customer_reviews.author: Todd30

customer_reviews.title: Replacement of fidget spinners
customer_reviews.text: I tend to bite my nails at times, and it can become a bad habit. Lately, I got these items, and they really help me. It's much more productive than a fidget spinner or biting my nails. Worth getting if you feel like fidgeting with something.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Its small enough to fit in your pocket and sturdy enough so you can take it anywhere you go
customer_reviews.text: The gripmaster is a must have for any musician. I play saxophone and rarely have time to practice but this product helps keep me in shape when I am away from my instrument. Its small enough to fit in your pocket and sturdy enough so you can take it anywhere you go. I use it a couple times a day just so my fingers don't get lazy and when I pick up my instrument I can feel the difference. I wouldn't recommend using it too often in the beginning as your hands may get sore because after all its an exercise but you can simply start off slow and work your way up.
customer_reviews.author: Jaydkay

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: I have started doing more rock climbing and have an upcoming trip planned so I though it would be helpful to buy a grip strengthening tool. After doing some research, I am really glad I went with the Gripmaster. It is a unique design and I really like that it gives the option to exercise each individual finger. I was torn between the medium and heavy tension but ended up going with the heavy. If you are trying to decide which strength to go with, I would recommend rounding up. It might be tough at first but you can always work your way up. Overall, it's a solid product with unique capabilities and I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: check the amount of resistance before you buy
customer_reviews.text: Only thing I'll say is don't be dumb like me. I didn't realize the resistance was set so low on this one. I like the one I bought, I was using it for a while, but b/c I didn't pay attention to the tension setting, it is way too low for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry P_ski

customer_reviews.title: Solid static weight hand/finger exerciser
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite hand/finger exerciser. I tried a couple others, like the one here: , but this one was more stable and solid than others I've seen. The con is that if you don't like the weight, there's no way to change it. I use it for rock climbing exercises while doing one-handed tasks or just killing time.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second gripmaster i have purchased, the first one lasted me 10 years with no problems. The most recent one I bought is just as great, but the rubber grip on the bottom came unglued a month after I bought it. No big deal nothing that couldnt be quickly fixed, little glue and its good as new. I expext this one to last a long time as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: comfortable for your grasp
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient: small, light, comfortable for your grasp; bought a few, so to keep one in my bag (use whenever I have time), and one on the table in front of the TV. I can exercise when I am watching movies. I consider of buying more as a gift for my friends
customer_reviews.author: romantic

customer_reviews.title: A must have, if you want strong hands, forarms and fingers!
customer_reviews.text: It is very well made and desighned to last. It is not to much stronger tension than the Medium tenion, but I will keep it. Also the handle is smaller and not as comfortable as the Medium tension. All in all, I will continue to us it on a regular basis 1000-1500 squezes per had a day.
customer_reviews.author: Daytona Rob

customer_reviews.title: Good for my home therapy
customer_reviews.text: I read other customer's review and it helped me. Since I had 3 surgeries on my left thumb, my left hand is so weak. It's perfect if the width is narrow. But it's still better than my last one.
customer_reviews.author: John Coley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product (for Guitar Players etc.)
customer_reviews.text: This product is really good. I was learning guitar and I needed to strengthen my fingers especially the pinky finger. Also good if you type a lot on computer. I bought two of these and gifted one to my mom. It's really good for hand/finger exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Manish Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Could use some changes.
customer_reviews.text: I do not think this was thought through, because not all fingers have the same strength. So setting all the resistance equal sounds silly. My pinky struggles, where my pointer finger and do these all day. I do not expect to curl as much as I can leg press. For those of you who exercise form is very, very important. For me quality is better than quantity and not being able to preform all fingers efficiently makes this some what useless (to me). I would like to be able to strengthen my whole hand. Maybe if there was one that has less pressure needed for the fingers with less use would be more ideal...
customer_reviews.author: BPM

customer_reviews.title: A little small for the fingers
customer_reviews.text: I recently had surgery and I got this to move my fingers and get the strength back. It works ok but the spacing of the finger springs is a little small for my fingers making it hard to exercise each finger separately
customer_reviews.author: D215

customer_reviews.title: Gradually lost tension
customer_reviews.text: This was great at first. I quickly moved up from Medium to Heavy tension. However, after less than a year of use, the springs loosened and what was supposed to be 9 lbs is more like 5lbs. The tension on the Medium is now greater than the tension on the Heavy. There are little bolts under the palm grip so I might be able to increase the tension but I shouldn't have to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Plain Jane

customer_reviews.title: Good strength/coordination product to use.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure get appropriate tension for person's use. Will be a great challenge fir husband with recent injury resulting in quadriplegia.
customer_reviews.author: shannan justus

customer_reviews.title: Good hand exercise while watching TV
customer_reviews.text: I like these hand exercisers for something to do while watching TV or waiting for a computer program to run. I have one at home and one at work. The individual finger springs allow you to really work each finger, even my wimpy pinky. This has really helped with lifting weights, strengthening my grip and, to a lesser extent my, wrists They also work as good stress relievers! The one that I bought about a year ago still works too. The only downside is that over time the springs become rather loud and are a bit annoying, but at ~$10, it is worth it to just replace.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Good for guitarists
customer_reviews.text: This exerciser really helped me build the strength for barre chords. After I started using this casually at my desk for just a week or two, my barre chord practice really took off after having previously struggled for years, and now I can do them with ease. Thinking of upgrading to the next level exerciser soon.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Bello

customer_reviews.title: Love it~
customer_reviews.text: Grip strength is important! And it shows your overall health level so I started working out my hands ^^ This one really helps you train your hand and arm. Love to workout my hands when I am reading or just chilling. Update: Still works~ My grip has becoming weaker so I will use it to work out my hands more :D
customer_reviews.author: P. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Grip master: A great tool to excercise your fingers for guitar or physical therapy
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these before and it "disappeared." I liked it so much that I bought another. Whether you need to excercise your hand/fingers, a beginning or experienced guitar player, this device works and the best one out there. A lot of value for the money. What's great is not only the ergonomics of this device but the fact you can either excercise your hand AND your individual fingers. There is also other grips with various tensions. This is a real winner.
customer_reviews.author: Vintage Vinyl Vets

customer_reviews.title: Not much resistance, still a good product.
customer_reviews.text: This grip was purchased for my 13 year old wrestler. I thought that this resistance level would be heavy enough. I was mistaken. Not to mention, it was non refundable and if you do want one with higher resistance, you had to keep buying the next one up. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Gripmaster Blue saved my chording hand
customer_reviews.text: I was having problems getting my finger strength back, following a broken hand and wrist, and most exercisers did not fully address the needs of a guitarist's dexterity and finger strength, once my therapist said I could begin an exercise program. This Light Tension device gave me everything I needed in an exerciser, and improved my playing noticeably within two weeks of regular exercising. I keep it in my gig bag, wherever I go, or in my pocket. Follow the guidelines that accompany the device for how often to use it. I am VERY happy with this item, which seems sturdy, and arrived exactly when I expected it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Helps therapy
customer_reviews.text: Overall: This helps build strength in your fingers. This is particularly helpful if you're recovering from an accident or injury. The tension isn't overwhelming, and is helpful from someone who is regaining their strength in their fingers. The gripmaster comes in different tensions, and Blue (Light Tension) is good for initial stages of recovery. Pros: + Not to tense + Comes in various tensions + Comfortable + Did not show any wear after 3 months of daily use + Easy to grip + Good for initial stages of physical recovery Cons: - None Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: A. Shrestha

customer_reviews.title: Start with this one
customer_reviews.text: You may be tempted to get the real hard one thinking that your big and bad and can do anything. The problem is that you will get frustrated once you find just how hard it is. Unless you are personally rehabbing or under a real and fully qualified Doctors care that wants you to start with minimum resistance most can start with this one and master it before moving up. Anywhere that finger strength needs to be improved or maintained can benefit from some simple exercises you can do while watching TV. I got this one to keep the fingers limber for player the guitar, and of course seeing how I am a novelist, writing.
customer_reviews.author: David K. Crabtree

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful, But Don't Over Do It
customer_reviews.text: My doctor suggested I get some form of hand exercise devise to deal with a troublesome "trigger finger" (really, that's what the ailment is called). I ordered the one with a "senior" resistance level and I found it extremely well made, and I used it faithfully. It sort of like have trumpet valves with no trumpet. Over a few weeks it it helped with my discomfort and I could feel that my hand had, overall, gained strength. It did exactly what it said it would. However, the first few days I thought the resistance was too light, and I overdid the repetitions. Sore hand! So, just "use as directed" and it should help you.
customer_reviews.author: Honest John

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I rock climb regally and wanted something to boost my grip strength that I could do at work. I chose this. I went one difficulty level down from what I thought I need, on some other reviewers recommendation, and I think this helped me do more reps through out the day. The grip master is small enough that I can keep in my pocket through out the day, and I pull it out every once in a while if I find my hands free. Works well and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Ewing

customer_reviews.title: Good for hand strength (and independent finger strength and movement)
customer_reviews.text: Good for hand strength (and independent finger strength and movement). Shooters, guitar players, anyone who needs strength and dexterity can benefit from this. Good product, inexpensive. Only negative is that the palm piece is not the optimal shape for me. Watch the poundage. 9 pounds sounded light, but remember it is 9 pounds each finger. Considering that the optimal use may be with the tips of the fingers, this is a fairly heavy gripper. For many of us, if you can't try before you buy, it might be good to consider getting a lighter one and working up to this one, or just getting the set that is offered.
customer_reviews.author: apextrainer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & Effective
customer_reviews.text: Go it to help with my rock climbing training and it is definitely assisting with my grip strength. It also pretty comfortable, I end up just walking around with it frequently, and it gives me something to fidget with as I go about my day!
customer_reviews.author: JoeLaro

customer_reviews.title: Good but need a higher tension version
customer_reviews.text: I have the Heavy tension (9lbs) which is a good starter but is too easy now. I have fairly fat fingers so really have to squeeze to get barre chords on guitar and while the Heavy is a good warmup I would like a version that is harder to squeeze.
customer_reviews.author: Mutt

customer_reviews.title: Great for musicians, but...
customer_reviews.text: This product is as good as expexted. I use to put my fingers in shape before practicing or recording. Its a great tool musicians(even though the package never mention us.... Sad face) The only reason I took one star off is because of the handler(however you call the part where you press your palm to) it gets really uncomfortable after a little while and I don't have any hand problem or wrist issue. Its missing a little bit more of support there. Besides that. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Matos

customer_reviews.title: Hand injury***
customer_reviews.text: I had a major hand injury back in March of 2018 that left me with a 5.3inch hole in my hand. I had to have two surgeries and did physical therapy for 4 months to get my strength and my full range of motion back in my hand. This product helped me so much. I purchased all of the different pressures. I have used this everyday for almost a year. Definitely worth the buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small, finger springs feel awkward. Dumpster bait.
customer_reviews.text: Product photos use a small hand, actual product almost two sizes too small, if it came in sizes. And spring per finger concept is awkward for me. Sent to circular file
customer_reviews.author: evan1138

product_meta.title: PROHANDS Gripmaster Hand Exerciser, Finger Exerciser (Hand Grip Strengthener), Spring-Loaded, Finger-Piston System, Isolate and Exercise Each Finger
product_meta.description: Prohands Gripmaster is the original, patented hand exerciser with individual power buttons. Now that our patents have expired, many imitators have appeared, and these products do not have the engineering and quality which goes into every hand exerciser we make. Beware of inferior quality imitation products from Asia. Prohands is the very best hand exerciser used by professional athletes, world-class musicians, and as a rehabilitation tool. Made from high-quality components ABS plastic, stainless steel springs and FDA-approved santoprene. With Prohands you can exercise each finger individually, or the entire hand. Use each button independently to exercise fingers or compress the entire unit for complete hand and forearm strengthening. By isolating each digit, stronger fingers can’t compensate for the weaker ones. Allowing the user to isolate and exercise each finger individually for strength, dexterity, and endurance. Helping to develop outstanding hand, wrist and forearm strength. Prohands is ideal for anyone wanting to develop and maintain strong healthy hands. May help with arthritis, carpal tunnel, neuropathy, and poor circulation. The Prohands family of hand exerciser comes in 4 different model types (2nd image). VIA is our entry-level model, GRIPMASTER is our signature model, GRIPMASTER-Rehab is our signature model with an added palm cushion, and PRO is our most advanced model for pros and motivated individuals. Each Prohands model features graduated tension levels, which help the user measure progress. VIA 1lb to 6lb, GRIPMASTER 1lb to 9lb, GRIPMASTER-Rehab 0.75lb to 9lb, and PRO 5lb to 13lb. Prohands is the ultimate hand and finger exerciser available on the market.
feature_bullets: THE ORIGINAL SPRING-LOADED HAND & FINGER EXERCISER: Prohands is used by professional athletes, world-class musicians, and as a rehabilitation tool. Made from high-quality components ABS plastic, stainless steel springs and FDA-approved santoprene.

STRENGTH, POWER & ENDURANCE FOR ATHLETES: Exercise each finger individually, or the entire hand. Isolates and exercises each finger individually for strength, dexterity, and endurance. Develops outstanding hand, wrist and forearm strength.
REHABILITATION & PREVENTION (STRONGER, HEALTHY HANDS): Ideal for anyone wanting to develop and maintain strong healthy hands. May help with arthritis, carpal tunnel, neuropathy, and poor circulation.

THE PROHANDS FAMILY OF HAND EXERCISERS (2ND IMAGE): VIA is our entry-level model, GRIPMASTER is our signature model, GRIPMASTER-Rehab has an added palm cushion, and PRO is our most advanced model for pros and motivated individuals.

VARIOUS TENSION LEVELS: Graduated tension levels help the user measure progress. VIA 1lb to 6lb, GRIPMASTER 1lb to 9lb, GRIPMASTER-Rehab 0.75lb to 9lb, PRO 5lb to 13lb. By isolating each digit, stronger fingers can’t compensate for the weaker ones.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
